meanings.definition: In a way that is greatly cherished or valued.
meanings.sent2: The antique ring was sold dearly at the auction.
meanings.sent3: The puppy looked at the bone dearly, as if it was the most precious thing in the world.
meanings.sent4: Her smile shone dearly, lighting up the room with warmth.
meanings.sent5: The memories of that day were etched dearly in her heart.

meanings.definition: At a high cost or price.
meanings.sent1: The rare painting was bought dearly by the art collector.
meanings.sent2: Gas prices have risen dearly in the past month.
meanings.sent3: He paid dearly for his impulsive decision to buy the expensive car.
meanings.sent4: The mistake cost him dearly, both financially and emotionally.
meanings.sent5: The repair work was priced dearly due to the specialized materials needed.

meanings.sent1: She hugged her friend dearly before saying goodbye.
meanings.sent2: He missed his family dearly while studying abroad.
meanings.sent3: The cat purred dearly as it snuggled up to its owner.
meanings.sent4: Their bond was dearly evident in the way they looked at each other.
meanings.sent5: The couple held hands dearly, walking along the beach at sunset.
